body.normal:
This class is designed for working with tree-structure data, along with xnode, It supports reading files in XML format, writing XML (http://www.w3.org/XML) and HTML, and XSLT transformation (http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt).
Working with tree is performed in DOM model (http://www.w3.org). DOM1 and some opportunities of DOM2 are available.
Class xdoc implements DOM-interface <a href=""http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/REC-DOM-Level-2-Core-20001113/core.html#i-Document" target="_blank">Document and is heir to class <a href=xnodeclass.htm">xnode.
Errors in DOM operations <a href=""http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/REC-DOM-Level-2-Core-20001113/core.html#ID-17189187" target="_blank">DOMException) interface) are converted into <a href=exceptions.htm">exceptions of xml-type.
